app.title: Voice Coach
app.subtitle: Your vocal training journey starts here

routine_descriptions.morning: Complete vocal warm-up and strengthening routine
routine_descriptions.weekend: Extended training with reading and advanced techniques
routine_descriptions.optional: Advanced training for targeted voice issues

breathing.inhale_instruction: Breathe in slowly through your nose
breathing.exhale_instruction: Exhale with a "sss" sound through your teeth

dbmeter.title: Voice dB Meter
dbmeter.subtitle: SPL Measurement for Voice Training
dbmeter.calibration_step1: Go to a quiet room (no talking, minimal noise)
dbmeter.calibration_step2: Start measuring and adjust the slider until it reads 35 dB
dbmeter.calibration_step3: This calibrates your device for accurate voice training measurements
dbmeter.why_35db_explanation: A quiet room (no conversation, minimal background noise) typically measures 30-40 dB SPL. This gives us a reliable reference point that's consistent across different environments.
dbmeter.permission_instructions: To use this dB meter, please allow microphone access:
dbmeter.permission_step2: When prompted, click "Allow" for microphone access
dbmeter.permission_step3: If you accidentally blocked it, click the lock/info icon in your browser's address bar
dbmeter.privacy_note: Note: No audio is recorded or transmitted - measurements are processed locally in your browser.
dbmeter.setup_instructions: Position your device 1 meter (3 feet) from your mouth at chest height. Use a measuring tape for accuracy. This standardized distance ensures consistent SPL readings for tracking progress.
dbmeter.healthy_practice_text: If your average conversation is below 60 dB, you may be speaking too quietly. If consistently above 75 dB, you might be straining. Aim for 60-70 dB with good resonance rather than forcing volume.
dbmeter.calibration_note: Note: This is a relative measurement tool. For clinical accuracy, use a calibrated SPL meter. Track changes over time rather than absolute values.
dbmeter.confirm_clear_log: Are you sure you want to clear all {{count}} saved readings?
